title: Migrating a POP account to IMAP on version 141.0 (64-bit)

content: Hi, I recently ungraded to the latest version of Thunderbird ( 141.0 (64-bit)), after doing this, I had to change a POP email account to IMAP. I did this while Thunderbird was closed. After relaunching, only a small amount of recent emails appeared. I noticed that the name on the local folder change from server to server. Am i doing something wrong?

title: Mail server problems
creator: hoofkantoornst
content:
I often move my Thunderbird data between my PC's as I move from one base to another and never had any problems in doing so.

I moved my data from my PC in South Africa to the one in Croatia, and now experience problems with one account. I have 5 email accounts on one domain, and these are all working fine.

One email account is for another domain which I have been using for years on Thunderbird, but I now cannot send or receive any emails on that. When receiving it just states "connection to the server has been reset" When sending I get this: "The message could not be sent because the connection to the Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.xxxx.co.za timed out." Nothing changed i.t.o. mail servers. I can send and receive emails on this account via Roundcube though.

I need help with this please.

title: Change in behaviour of "Delete Message" button
creator: mike.franklin
content: I receive a lot of emails that are really just the attachment (usually invoices etc.) So I right click the attachment and save it and then hit the "Delete" button to delete the email to the recycle folder. This has always worked fine in the past but now it tries to delete just the attachment, which is still selected following my save, warning me that it will permanently delete the attachment. This is a nuisance more than anything else. However when you hover over the delete button it describes itself as "delete this message" not this attachment, so the behaviour is both wrong and annoying. I can find no settings that will change this behaviour.

title: Berichten zijn verdwenen in aangemaakte mappen
creator: erik.van.der.eycken
content: In mijn Thunderbird mail inbox had ik mappen aangemaakt om binnenkomende mails (facturen) te sorteren (via label) naar boekjaar enz...Hierin stonden berichten netjes leesbaar over een periode vanaf 2022 tot nu, inclusief labels om zo per boekjaar te sorteren. Sinds ca 1 maand zie ik er nog maar 10 berichten staan met de oudste van 2023 en de meest recente van 17/6/25. Er is geen enkele systematiek te zien in welke berichten zijn verwijderd. Er staan nog enkele berichten van 2023, 2024 en ééntje van 2025, ad random. Bij controle op de webmail van mijn server telenet.be zie ik slechts die 10 berichten. Ik heb geen filters of wat dan ook ingeschakeld. Zonder enige reden zijn de berichten zo maar verdwenen van mijn computer en blijkbaar ook van de server. Dit is echt een raadsel, kan ik die berichten nog ergens terug recupereren ???? mvg Erik
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/139.0.0.0;kb_visits_prior:["/nl/kb/imap-synchronisatie"]

title: Prevent user from enabling/allowing remote content
creator: noise
content:
Setting up Thunderbird for some non-technical users that receive messages with tracking images, scripts etc. We would like to prevent users from enabling/allowing remote content; in other words, we would like Thunderbird not to display the “Preferences” button or the whole “To protect your privacy, Thunderbird has blocked (…)” bar, like it is visible in Remote Content in Messages. Is it doable in current Thunderbird versions?

Setting permissions.default.image=2 seems to actually block remote images even if user tries to allow them, which is good but confusing. It also breaks images in the build-in web browser, it is unintended. We are unsure if the setting applies to all kinds of remote content.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/remote-content-in-messages", "/pl/kb/zdalna-tresc-w-wiadomosciach"]

content: My ability to send email from kay@haushousellc.com from Thunderbird stopped working on both of my computers. Msg came up saying the smtp server had timed out. title: Thunderbird event times are moved back one hour?
creator: dmitri3
content:
For some reason, when I add a new event to one of my Thunderbird calendars, it shows up an hour later when I reopen Thunderbird.

For example: 1) create a new event at 9am and sync 2) close Thunderbird 3) reopen Thunderbird 4) event is at 10am

The native iOS calendar app still shows it at 9am, as does the web interface for the calendar provider (Hetzner webhosting). Once the times are shifted, they stay consistent, but the issue happens again if I try to edit the time an hour back.

I have verified that I am using the New York timezone everywhere.

I have an Outlook calendar in Thunderbird as well (using the Owl plugin), but it doesn't seem to have this issue.

Any thoughts? Thank you!

content:
I've installed Thunderbird 128.13.0esr (64 bit) on a Chromebook Linux sandbox and copied the email profile from a Windows 10 system.

title: Display Name in Email Addresses received in INBOX
creator: mansoor.ijaz
content:
Good afternoon Thunderbird Help Community,

My Inbox in Thunderbird has always allowed me to add an email address for an incoming email sender and then edit that address as was best for organizing the mailbox.

So, for example, this email address:

Bobby Jersey <BobbyJersey@garwoodsecurities.net> does not allow me to add it to my Address book or edit the name to be for example BROKER-GWS Bobby Jersey vs. the full name and email address spelled out.

On the other hand, an email received from another sender Rui Amorim <rui.amorim@chase.com> could be added and edited from Amorim, Rui to Rui Amorim.

I don't understand how to fix this and why it seems so random as to which addresses are accepted and which not.

Thanks for any help to clarify what should be done to fix this.

Best, Mansoor IJAZ <mansoor.ijaz@ijazholdings.com>

title: I have an odd setup , with lost of folders and filters and want to switch one POP account to IMAP
creator: modemjunkie
content:
I have been using Thunderbird on my desktop since the end of Eudora, but moving forward from computer to computer has created some problems.

Looking at Thunderbird here is what I see.

LEN POP which is configured as a POP account with the standard folders: Drafts , Sent, Junk and Trash There is also a folder called Archives with subfolders for the years 2021-2025, There are also a couple of special folders Like News and Events. and a folder called xxx NUL with about 10,000 emails for the years 2022 and 2023.

Then here is GMAIL which is setup as a standard IMAP account. (or some reason copies of some sent messages from the POP account are saved here.


Then there is LOCAL FOLDERS which contains again the standard subfolders, and then more than 20 folders which are populatde by mail filters from the inbox. It seem most of the mail here comes from the inbox in the POP account. (I often see a notice like" 40 messages moved from inbox to inbox."

On my phone and iPad I have my accounts set up as IMAP.

HERE'S THE PROBLEM

From time to time the POP account starts downloading thousands and thousand of old emails. Today it was over 29,000 messages. I disabled downloading of messages and ran the duplicate remover on each folder, and got rid of as many as I could, of of course as soon as I clicked "get messages" the 29,000 mail dumps started again. (This does not happen on my phone or iPad).

It has been suggested that I should switch to IMAP on the desktop, but I would like to filter mail into the same local folders using the old filters, which I have developed over many years.

QUESTION So, Is there a relatively simple way to do this.

Thanks, Len
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/120.0.0.0

title: Can't send email from Thunderbird
creator: adrian5750
content:
Hi folks Recent problem in the last couple of days. Thunderbird can't send email through my provider (Blacknight.ie) - using their Titan email handling. Settings - which worked perfectly until a few days ago are

Description - blacknight titan Server - smtp0101.titan.email Port - 465 Security - SSL/TLS Auth. - Normal password Username - my email address

Error messsage is Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp0101.tital.email timed out. Try again.

FWIW - I _can_ send from Thunderbird via my gmail account, and my wife's PC (same LAN / router) can send email via Blacknight's legacy system, which doesn't run on Titan (as far as I know).

I'm baffled! Any ideas please?

Thanks Adrian

title: No puedo guardar archivos anexos en mi computadora
creator: nmontielm
content:
Hola,

Hace unos días comencé a tener problemas al intentar guardar archivos anexos a correos que recibo. Son archivos en formato pdf o simplemente imágenes jpg.

Anteriormente nunca había tenido este problema. Los archivos son muy importantes para mi trabajo.

Les pido su amable orientación para solucionar este asunto, gracias desde ahora por su apoyo. Saludos

María M

title: Thunderbird not syncing Gmail folders properly after August update?
creator: coreylprl
content:
Hi all, Since the August 2025 update, I've noticed Thunderbird is no longer syncing some of my Gmail folders (mostly labels I created manually in Gmail). The inbox syncs fine, but custom labels show up empty or don’t appear at all.

Things I’ve tried:

Removing and re-adding the Gmail account using OAuth

Checking Gmail’s IMAP settings — all folders are selected for sync

Rebuilding folder index files in Thunderbird

I didn’t have this issue before the latest Thunderbird update. Is anyone else seeing this? Could it be a bug with label handling or IMAP path prefix?

Any advice would be appreciated!

title: Lost archived and old sent emails
creator: skmendres
content:
My Windows 11 laptop was upgraded (RAM and SSD) last weekend and I'm in the process of restoring it. Before I sent it in to upgrade, I used Norton to create a recovery backup and now have used that backup to populate my C: drive. The apps did not install. I downloaded the Thunderbird app through google chrome and re-created my accounts, but I no longer have the older emails, especially older SENT emails and any of my Archive folders. (I had an Archive of all my Inbox and Sent folders for each year back for years now.)

I have looked through the various support questions on this community forum but I can't figure out how to get my historical emails back.

BTW, I also have complete Norton backups of all my drives, but it is only the C: drive that is in question.
